answers.answer: Here's a few ideas to help lower blood pressure. They go hand in hand with suggestions on control and managing your diabetes. Others may come along with additional tips.Blood pressure -• Eat less sodium [salty foods]• If available, eat oatmeal for breakfast• Maintain healthy body weight [watch the waistline]• Avoid and/or limit alcohol• If you smoke, stop smoking• Exercise, exercise, exercise• Reduce stress• Eat a diet rich in whole grains, fruits, vegetables and lean meatsDiabetes -All the above and include no sugary foods/liquids, no foods made with white flour [breads, crackers], no simple carbs, and limit complex carbs. Eat fruits with other foods and in small portions.
